result.execSummary:
The defendant Ashlee A. Martinson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • 2nd-Degree Intentional Homicide, a class B felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.05(1).
  • 2nd-Degree Intentional Homicide, a class B felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.05(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: Costs should have been made collection through DOC- amended JOC -
Letter from Judge re: Petition for waiver of Prepayment of fees

11:04 AM Defendant Ashlee A. Martinson in court, in custody from the Taycheedah Correctional Institution, appearing by video. Michael William Schiek appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court statement to motion filed for release of evidence. Defendant represents self. Court questions Defendant on what she is wanting. Martinson states she would like evidence in order to represent herself. Court statement to items in court file - public has access - fee has to be paid - waiver of fees. Defendant statement to her list - received from Oneida County Sheriff's office. Schiek statement to discovery. Court questions Defendant on prior counsel and if they provided discovery to her. States he only saw some items - contacted prior counsel and was told they did not have. Schiek states he does not believe he is obligated to provide - believes motion if frivolous - does not know why she would want items. Court takes judicial notice that case was resolved in circuit court - was appointed appellate counsel - appeal was affirmed - defense counsel should turn over items if they have it - needs statute/law provided that requires Court to turn items over. Defendant states she understands. Court statement how to obtain items from Court file. Defendant states received written responses from her prior counsel. Court will send Defendant the petition for waiver of costs - when received will direct COC to provide items requested from Court file - states she is representing self and must do research - Court can not be her counsel. adj. 11:22 PM
Letter to Judge re: appearance at hearing
Motion hearing on June 25, 2021 at 11:00 am.

denying motion for postconviction relief

10:04 a.m. Defendant Ashlee A. Martinson in court appearing telephonically from Tayceedah Correctional Facility with attorney Mark A. Schoenfeldt.  Michael William Schiek appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court notes that Order to Transport was filed; however Order was not provided to Sheriff; since today is non-evidentiary in nature; personal appearance by defendant is not required. Court in receipt of and has reviewed written briefs. Schoenfeldt statement to motion. Schiek statement to motion. Court statement on sentencing. Court did not abuse discretion and denies motion. Court will draft Order consistent with today's findings. Adj. 10:33 a.m.
Defendant's Reply Brief
In Opposition to Motion for Post Convction Relief
In Support of Post-Conviction Relief Motion
for Post-Conviction Relief

from Special Administrator
State's Exhibit 1 - Restitution Hearing - originals retained in Exhibit drawer

3:12 p.m. Defendant Ashlee A. Martinson, in custody, in court with attorneys Thomas Wilmouth and  Amy Lynn Ferguson.  Michael William Schiek appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court in receipt of Defendant's memorandum on restitution and State's itemization of restitution. Both parties in receipt of documentation. Court questions regarding insurance proceeds- Schiek has no knowledge - Wilmouth - status of sealed probate file - Per Registrar in Probate - waiting to proceed in probate matter until Special Administrator is appointed and prepares report. Court states that a determination of life insurance proceeds is a significant factor which needs to be made prior to any decision on restitution. State is in agreement to recess / Wilmouth prefers to proceed today. Schiek statement on restitution. State marks Exhibit 1 (Redacted Restitution packet)- received. Exhibits attached to Defendant's Memorandum are received.  Defense calls Ashlee Martinson/ sworn/ direct by Wilmouth/ cross by Schiek  / Court questions defendant. Schiek statement. Wilmouth statement. Court statement per 973.20 - compensable restitution - funeral expenses Exhibits 1, 2 and 3 are not disputed; attorney fees for probate matters - entire amount billed would be eligible for restitution - question remains if they are compensable Exhibits 4, 5, 6, 7 - Court finds well accepted civil principle that general damages are specifically defined amounts of money that have been paid or need to be paid - special damages are pain and suffering, loss of use, etc. Claimant's out of pocket expenses are special damages. Counseling services (Exh 8)-Court needs to determine what portions of Gribble case are applicable. Court finds that Rumore is victim for purposes of restitution hearing. Court considers financial ability of defendant. Defendant's ability to make meaningful payments towards restitution while in prison are minimal. Court finds that no restitution will be ordered for Gallaghers. Court takes matter of restitution under advisement until Probate matter resolves issue of life insurance proceeds. Wilmouth - concerned about finality for defendant - Defendant waives time limits for demand for final restitution - Wilmouth requests defendant's return on Writ. Defendant to be returned to prison system. Adj. 5:00 p.m.
Defendant's Memorandum on Restitution

9:45 a.m. Defendant Ashlee A. Martinson in court with attorney Thomas Wilmouth and attorney Amy Lynn Ferguson.  Defendant Ashlee A. Martinson in custody.  Michael William Schiek appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court states that State has requested minor witness statements be heard in chambers - Defense has no objection - Court finds that State has met burden for hearing in chambers pursuant to Woller v. Georgia and grants State's request. Defense motion for in camera inspection - Court determined nothing contained in records that will be lawfully disclosable to defense for purposes of trial - if for purposes of sentencing - in record in other forms. Court in receipt of May 9, 2016 letter from Attorney Wilmouth concerning minor clarification to Attachment A to Plea Agreement  - will be made part of Court record - not of significant consequence to sentencing. Recess 9:51 a.m. 
In Chambers- Now present, minors, V.A. and L.A. with guardians - Court reads written statements by V.A. and L.A. Exhibit 1 (V.A. statement) and Exhibit 2 (L.A. statement) marked. 
10:04 a.m. - On record. Exhibit 3 (Gallagher letter) marked. Exhibit 4 (Curtis letter) marked. Exhibits received. State witness S.R. called/sworn/statement/Wilmouth questions witness/Schiek questions witness/Witness further comments to Court. Schiek statement on sentencing. Side bar - 11:31 a.m. On record - 11:40 a.m. Schiek continues statement. Side bar - 12:11 p.m.; On record - 12:17 p.m. Schiek continues statement. Recess 12:34 p.m. 
1:09 p.m. - On record - Ferguson statement. Schiek statement - Exhibit 5 marked - Sandy Rumore statement - Received. Schiek statement that video being shown in court today will be available online and information will be provided to media or interested public. Exhibit 6 (DVD) marked, played in its entirety. Recess 3:39 p.m.
3:48 p.m. - On record - Defense marks Exhibit 7 (Ciricullum Vitae of Sheryl Dolezal), Exhibit 8 (Report of Sheryl Dolezal), and Exhibit 9 (Report of Knudson & Smith). Defense witness L.K. called/sworn/statement/Schiek questions witness. Defense calls Dr. Sheryl Dolezal/sworn/Ferguson direct/ Exhibit 7 - received /direct continues/Schiek cross/Ferguson redirect. Wilmouth statement on sentencing. Recess 6:12 p.m. 
6:23 p.m. - On record - Schiek/Wilmouth agree to file written Stipulation as to restitution. Court statement on sentencing. Has considered written letter from Defendant-will be marked as Exhibit 10 and received.

Amended

10:04 a.m. Defendant Ashlee A. Martinson in court with attorneys Amy Lynn Ferguson and Thomas Wilmouth. Michael William Schiek, DA, appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Amended Information, Plea Agreement and Plea Questionnaire & Waiver filed. Court statement--plea agreement and waiver of rights form submitted to the court prior; speaks to stipulation signed by defendant and counsel/DA with attached factual information in support of charges--2 cts. 2nd-Degree Intentional Homicide. Court has reviewed paperwork. Wilmouth in receipt of Amended Information, waives reading. Court statement--speaks to s. 940.01, s. 940.01(2a), s. 939.44(1)(a)/(1)(b), s. 940.01(3); facts/circumstances described in agreement; reasonable doubt. Court accepts Amended Information--finds reasonable and not against public interest. Defendant pleads guilty to 2 cts. 2nd-Degree Intentional Homicide in Amended Information. Court reads on waiver of rights and tendering plea; waiver free and voluntary; finds factual basis for plea exists and finds defendant guilty. Court revokes bond at this time. 10:30 a.m. adj.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for June 17, 2016 at 09:00 am.

2:03 p.m. Defendant Ashlee A. Martinson, in custody, in court via video with attorney Amy Lynn Ferguson.  Michael William Schiek appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court statement on evaluation - Ferguson requests 75 days for defense to have own evaluation. Court orders that Dr. Smith's report be sealed pending further order of Court. Adj. 2:04 p.m.  Status conference scheduled for March 4, 2016 at 11:00 am.
